title: Always fails to launch
body:
When I launch LoL the icon will bounce up and down just like every other app does. But when it stops, nothing happens. It just sits there and never opens the game... I've fixed it multiple times but it keeps happening!

I've done the whole copying of UserKernel thing which worked the first time. But once I closed the game and reopend it again, bang, same problem.

Also not trying to constantly re-download the whole darn game everytime I want to play... So any idea on how to PERMANENTLY fix this issue?

macOS Sierra
Version 10.12.4
15 inch early 2011

Thanks!

replies.body: I'm not a fan of the copying and modifying files here, it's likely to end up causing you more issues and crashing later on.  The issue you're having is likely caused by a security setting preventing league from being launched.  You'll want to specifically go over each step of the [permissions](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/204134104-Setting-up-your-Permissions) guide to help fix this up by allowing League as an exception permanently.  Let me know if you have any questions!

UPDATE:

After some research, I found this:

"copy and paste this on your terminal.app

sudo /Applications/League\ of\ Legends.app/Contents/MacOS/RiotMacContainer

if you don't know where your terminal is, go to Launchpad > Other then click on the terminal

p.s. do not close the terminal"

And believe it or not, it worked! Kinda weird seeing it launched this way but it completely worked (as of right now at least).
